3:20pm: Call location because I never received the confirmation call I was supposed to. I was told in broken english that my order would be delivered 1hr after it was placed. 
3:30pm: Tried to figure out why I never received an email confirmation.
4:00pm: Started to get worried when my pizza was not there.
4:15pm: Called to see where my pizza was. Was put on hold for 5min and then was told she had to call the driver and find out, that she would call me back. Never heard back.
4:45pm: Called again, was asked if I could be put on hold but before she got the -old out I interrupted and informed her that my pizza was 45min late. She then began to argue with me, saying that it was only 25min late
4:50pm: Hallelujah my Cold, Soggy pizza is finally here.

I ate at a RT in Sacramento about a month ago just because.....well thats all Sacramento has, and it was pretty good. This experience was obviously due to piss poor management. I will never order from here again and I hope people will read this and not make the same mistake as I did. Call up Stelladoro, its cheaper and they will get it to you in about 30 min.
author: Jackson D.

description: I'm only giving two stars cause I usually love round table and their pizza. yet the service at the Van Ness location was a sad excuse for customer service. Im pretty sure if the delivery guy could have sat on our pizza on the way over, (the hour and a half it took to get to our house).  and who doesn't automatically give ranch with buffalo wings? this is america people.
author: Ashley M.

description: Worst experience at a Round Table Pizza place. Called ahead to order pizza for pick up. I was on time for order. A Hispanic male verified my order and I paid for pizza's. He went back to get pizza and found out the order was never put in or pizza maker just forgot. First he said its "in the oven, not done" I asked him if that was true and he said no. We just didn't make it.  He did say we can make it in 15 minutes. I asked to speak to Manager. He replied the Manager Carlos was not there. I then asked for a credit on my card that I used to purchase the pizza and he was reluctant to do that. He finally gave me a credit receipt, but still have not seen anything. This cashier never apologized or offered any solution other than waiting another 15 or 20 minutes. I walked out.
author: joe c.

description: The pizza was burned-dark black areas on the crust and the canadian bacon and it  tasted like charcoal. Then the clerk argues with me on the phone when I call to request to exchange the pizza. I hear a lady in the background yelling out to the guy on the phone rudely like she was cueing him to argue with me.  An hour later the delivery guy "Aaron" has the nerve to warn me rudely he will charge me  (twice) if it happens again! ...because we each bit a slice if the pie (returning like 8 out of 10 slices). I guess he wanted me to give him back the bitten slices too on our plates.  Fine.  As I went to get the plates he started making some pissed off remark I can't repeat.  I told the guy I didn't want to argue with him and just wanted an edible pizza. Don't give this rude branch your business my tip.  Try Goat Hill Pizza.
author: Caroline D.

description: I like Round Table and seeing that I am surveying slice pizza places in SF and the Van Ness Round Table serves by the slice I broke my "no large chain" rule.  I wish I hadn't.  It was a large piece for $3.15 (cheese) but it seemed everything was out of proportion and they lost the balance that makes their regular pizzas so good.  The 2 stars are for their slices the normal pizzas are still good.
author: Jeff J.

description: I miss this place. The lunch specials are great. I love the salad bar, except the pasta salad is nasty. I recommend the skinny crust, with extra sauce and light cheese, with bacon on top. I loved accruing stamps and getting a free meal out of it.
author: Andrew K.

description: I don't recommend anyone to order from this round table pizza because the last time i ordered for a delivery, the pizza came with a LOT of hair in it. The pizza should be named, "HAIR PIZZA" because there was a whole LAYER OF HAIR TOPPINGS on and inside the pizza sauce, to top is off, some of the hair was curly. TRUE STORY, i am not making this up. GROSSNESS!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: Honestly, I would rather go to pizza hut.  Got RoundTable last night since they are having a $10 pizza special.  The pizza wasn't too bad.  Definitely not the best I have had in the city, but it was ok.  I also got a salad to go with the pizza and I will say their salad bar is horrible.  The lettuce is some of the worst iceburg I have ever seen and they were running low or out of quite a bit of stuff.  Some of the things that were in stock, the tomatoes and cucumbers for example, looked like they had been sitting out for a while.  Plus it was $5.99 for the salad.  Another disappointment.  I can't believe I paid almost as much for the salad as the pizza.  Maybe they should just stick to pizza.  Plus, if they didn't have the $10 deal I would NOT eat there.  It would have been $18.99 for my 1 topping pizza!!!  Definitely NOT worth it!
author: Jessica D.

description:
Let's see, this place was like home to me for awhile. I went to high school around the corner, and my friends and I used to come here after school to hang out, do homework and eat. Now it helped that one of our friends was good friends with a few of the employees, because I hardly ever remeber opening up my wallet, but I would have paid for what we eat regardless.

So the garlic twists, an ode to. Seriously though, these things are orgasmic. I could sit around all day and eat these things, dipped in ranch dressing. Its hard to even articulate it. Anyway, the service has gone down hill since I frequented this place, but the garlic twists bring back such fond memories.

Also, If you get these guys on the phone late at night and happen to be under any sort on influence, they are great at talking you into ordering more food than you intended. "what? I have to order how much food to get this delivered" eruption of giggles "okay, well how about i get 4 orders of garlic twists and a pizza? yeah? okay "  But for all it was worth, we ate every last bite and enjoyed it all.
author: Allyson S.

description: Ordered pizza around 8pm.  Called at 9:30 to ask where my pizza was.  The girl said the delivery driver had just left, yet it took another 30 minutes to arrive.  When I did finally get the pizza after two hours, it was lukewarm and over-cooked.  Avoid.
author: Tim S.

description: do not come here! the workers are rude and UNHELPFUL! worst pizza place ever!
author: Q W.

description: They messed up my last order last night! I ordered a specialty pizza and they left out some ingredients! If you're going to charge an arm and a leg for your pizza at least get it right! I work hard for my money and don't like throwing it away. I feel jipped!
author: Marla Y.

description:
Round Table advertises on the Sharks website to give a free personal pan pizza(1 topping) if the Sharks score 4 goals.  But it's a scam here in SF.  Every Round Table I call is either NOT participating, or they have extra conditions, like you have to buy a 10cent drink for $2.  Or only one per person per visit.  what a scam.  No wonder I don't like them.
My advice to the Corporation is to make your franchisees live up to what you've advertised.  The Sharks should drop you losers.
author: Bill F.

description: Ordered a simple delivery of 1 pizza. 2 hours later still hasn't arrived. I have called them twice, once after an hour to check on the order, they said it was on its way, second call after 2 hours, they said the driver was 15 minutes away. We are located less then 10 minutes away.....just absolute lies. They offered a free pizza next time, this is the first time I have tried Round Table and will not be trying again. Cancelled order, simply hopeless !!!
author: Tim M.

description: Judging from the other reviews I've read, my awful experience at this Round Table was not an exception. One time I was in there and saw an exposed bulb hanging from the ceiling in one part of the store. Hmmm not a good sign. One of the employees was making fun of another employee to a customer. They screwed up my order and when I tried to complain I essentially was told to shut up. Avoid this place if you possibly can, it does suck.
author: Todd H.

description: My company recently has been spending approximately $300 a week at this location to feed our employees as well as conference classes to which we have been hosting.  I figured I would call to see if we were spending approx. $1,200 a month on pizza it wouldn't hurt to ask if there was any discount incentive and figured it would be a win win for both us & this location.  The worst they could say was no.  However, I was wrong.  I called at 6:00 on June 18 and requested to speak with the manager.  I was informed I was speaking with the manager and his name was Mike.  When I asked, he was INCREDIBLY rude and before I could even explain  my situation (and after being put on hold TWICE so he could talk to another employee) he interrupted me & rudely said could "just get to the point & make a long story short." He then told me that even if I spent $300 a week with them, that "he only makes 10% so he would only make $30 so whats the point."  He gruffly continued to say that if I wanted a discount then I would have to buy much more than $300 a week (again $1,200 a month) to get a discount & if I wanted one that I should just look to my mailbox bc that's the only discount theyre gonna give no matter how loyal of a customer you are.  Had he simply said "no" I wouldn't have an issue.  After all, I was only asking because I thought the worst they could say was no.  However, after the treatment I received was so condescending and rude that I will never support them nor the treatment that they dealt out.  If they treat a loyal customer like myself and my company like that, how would they treat me if I were only spending $24? To me customer service is everything and I would rather pay extra to have our pizzas picked up from now on than support them.  If you care about how your business is valued, this is NOT the place for you
author: Sam S.

description: Knight, good sir, I challenge thee to a duel. You should be ashamed to call yourself a pizza chain. Expensive, incompetent and tasty as thy horse's bridle. I shall ride to the depths of hell with Dominos before I see the likes of you again.
author: Michael E.

description: I used to live right above this restaurant.They have variety of pizza with multiple toppings to choose from and salad bar is awesome. People that work there dont get off until 2-3am. They work really hard. The service is mediocre but pleasant and patient on phone order. They let you know in advance how long it takes to prepare pizza for you. I prefer round table better than domino's pizza anytime.
author: Michael K.

description: First time I ordered round table it took two 2 hours - no exaggeration! Not only that but the delivery guy came to the door and paid him for the pizza, I gave him a 3.00 tip, (27.00 total, 30 bucks total) he put his foot in the door as I walked away and said "is that all" (as if I screwed him on the tip) across the room.   Seriously?  2 hours, cold pizza, 3 bucks, I think that is a fair trade at this point and perhaps a bit generous...   The conversation from there was fairly short as I slammed the door... unreal..
author: Brian K.

description: I  purchased a Groupon Daily Deal for Round Table Pizza  Today at around 6pm, it was a ONE DAY ONLY 10am to 10pm a $20 value for $13.  Around 7pm ordered a large pizza by phone, arrived about 20 min later to be told 'WE DON'T ACCEPT THOSE ANYMORE", I explained I had JUST bought online.  Both employees where rude and refused to call the owner/manager to help. I told them that these are being sold right now and other people will be having the same problem, please call your boss and tell him. At this point the woman turned her back on me and the man just looked away!   I am so upset about this, both Groupon and Round Table on Van Ness.  Wasted over an hour of my time for nothing.   I am done with Groupon and Round Table............As to other reviews about delivery;  NEVER try delivery at this place, Will always take at least 90 minutes IF they even bother to show up with your cold pizza!  The owner obviously does not care about his business.
author: John C.

description: Can someone please tell me how it could possibly take over an hour and a half to make a frickin pizza and deliver it to my house 10 blocks away??  It just absolutely blows me away.... the pizza, once I got it, was great.  This made me remember why i stopped ordering from national pizza chains... Round Table, Domino's, and Pizza Hut all blow. Ridiculous....
author: A B.

description:
This place sucks!!! I tried ordering from another round table location since I love their pizza but the Van Ness one was the designated location for my address. Crap.

So I have order 2 times from this location. 

1st time, it was a Thursday night and I was tired from a long day at work. So decided to treat myself to a mess free dinner. I ordered and the lady said it would take 45mins to get to me which would be around 6:45pm. Perfect, right before the basketball final starts at 7pm. So we wait and we waited. We even called the RT and asked where's our pizza and they said it went out 1 hr ago?! By the time the pizza guy got here, it was 8pm!!!! You have my cell, if you are lost you should have called me! What was worst was that my pizza was cold and burnt, the garlic twist that we got was burnt as well and you can't even eat it, it's rock hard.

2nd time we ordered it 'cause we couldn't get the other location to deliver it to us. And was hoping that it was only a one time thing. This time the pizza guy got here on time right on the dot. But again, the pizza was burnt!!!

Never ordering from this location again.
author: Susan L.

description: This is really only for delivery. I have quite a love affair with their chicken garlic pizza and well... I call them up and they bring me one.
author: Constance C.

description: For a chain pizza joint, it is not that bad.  Grew up on it, having pizza with my family on Friday nights in central California, so maybe there is some sort of built-in fondness.  But prices are decent, they deliver, and pizza is consistently good and seems to appease most people from different parts of the country.
author: Lucas M.

description: The ULTIMATE pepperoni and mushroom pizza. I can't live without it. This play has not skipped a beat in the past 10 years!
author: A D.

description: Just like any other Round Table.  I actually like their salad bar a lot. The choices actually look fresh and they taste fresh as well. I like their Italian dressing.  This location seemed to have enough seating. Your ordered at the counter, take a number and your pizza will be delivered to your table if you are dining in.  I ordered the Garlic Parmesan Twists, Salad and Soda for $6.49.  I like my twists on the soft side and they came out perfect, just the way I like them.  For kids, there are gumball machines and arcade games like the old-school Rampage.  Friendly counter person.
author: Bernadette M.

description: About par for a Round Table Pizza place. Although when it is difficult for the cashier to understand what I am ordering it does become a bit problematic to make sure you get what you want! Our order did come out like we ordered it, but it was the sorryiest looking thing I have ever eaten. The breadsticks were over cooked and super small compared to how I am used to seeing them and the pizza was a bit doughy.
author: Tyler D.

description:
my parents live in san francisco near van ness. and the closest round table there is the one on van ness st. so we had ordered an xl pizza for pick up. i did not expect anything that was going to ruin my appetite until the moment i picked up my pizza and asked for cheese and red pepper. the man in the front which happened to be the manager said that they had ran out of cheese. so i asked for ranch and the man had charged me 50 cents for a container of ranch. i find it hard to believe that a pizza place has no cheese and red pepper. so i went back to my moms house disappointed. 

a few weeks later there was another gathering at my moms place and she had told me to order round table again so i gave it another shot to see if service was better. i called for delivery and it was a man on the phone. he asked for my phone number and found my address on his computer as they save it after u order once. i had ordered the same thing like before. and asked for ranch. the man on the phone wanted to charge me 80 cents for a container of ranch. and said "RANCH ARE NOT FOR PIZZA" i had told him i ordered there before and you only charged me 50 cents. he said ok. ill give you one ranch. as soon as the delivery boy knocked on my door he asked me for a coupon. i said excuse me? he said that if i didn't have a coupon it will be 3 dollars more. i said i want to call the manager i was talkin to when i ordered the pizza because he had never told me about any coupon to present when u get here. he said that it was ok i dont have to call the manager on him. then quickly said "how much tip are you giving me?" i had already gave him 4 dollars of tip but he wanted more. as i close the door slowly he yelled and said "CHEAP BAST*RD"! 

 this is the worst round table i had ever experienced. and promise to never order from this place ever again. pizza is good but service is really really BAD!!!!  i like the round table better out in pinole.
author: rob a.

description: Lousy service.. DO NOT order from them...Last Friday we order 2 pizzas at 1030am, called again on 11:30 and was told driver was on his way, 1215pm passed by no pizza. called to cancel the order but was told the driver had left the shop. Pizza didn't show up until 1245pm. Called and talked to Mike. He promised to send the gift certificate and vip coupon (free pizza) in the mail Friday night but no sign of coupons and today is Wednesday... Lied through their teeth... can't trust them and can't rely on them....worse experience ever... 3 hours for an order of pizza...
author: Steven C.

description:
Unfortunately I live near this round table pizza and I will never order pizza here again. The staff answering the phone is super rude.  I see this as a reflection of the management's lack of skill in hiring and in training.  This is my number one complaint.  I believe everyone is bound to make mistakes but it is how a business deals with the mistakes that distinguishes businesses

I ordered a pizza at 7 pm.  I was informed it will take 45 minutes to an hour.  At 8:30 I called to check on the status.  I was told that the pizza was sent out to my home "a long time ago".  I said well I still don't have it.  To which the person on the phone says "are you sure?"  I told her that since she obviously doesn't know how to solve the problem I would like to talk to a manager.  She said that she does not know who the owner or the manager is.  Few minutes later I got another call this time from a woman identifying herself as the manager and saying the "truth us that the driver took the pizza but came back forgetting to deliver it".  I then said then please be sure I get a new one since this 1 hour old pizza is going to be cold.  She said that she is warming it in the oven and will send a warm pizza.  Before I had a chance to hang up with pizza the 2 hour old cold pizza arrived (9 pm).  I called back and said that obviously you lied since the pizza is here, it is cold and she never sent a fresh or warm pizza.  

Also the manager told me more than a few times that I should not tip the driver since this is his fault.  I never see the problem at the bottom but at the top.  This is why in both cases I did tip the driver.

The biggest problem is the entire time the manager spoke to me she was yelling and I had to hold the phone away from my ear.  

The worst part is that this is the second time this EXACT same scenario happened with this pizza place.
author: Simone D.

description: i know this pizza is just average.  but i grew up on it.  so it tastes strangely like the best pizza i've ever had everytime i order it.  and they deliver to my house.  what else could you ask for?  you must eat it with A&W root beer.
author: a g.
